gurmukhi: piRqmwnn nr khUM dyK prY ]kCu buD bl bcn ibcwr krY ]
transliteration: Pritmaanan Nar Kahoon Dekh Darai|| Kachh(u) Budh Bal Bachanndbichaar Darai||
translation: The people look like the stone-images and somewhere the dialogues are held with power of intellect;

gurmukhi: nr nwrn eykn nyk mqM ]inq ArQwnrQ gin`q gqM ]112]
transliteration: Nar Naaran Ekan Nek Matan|| Nit Arthaanarth Gaditt Gadan||112||
translation: There are many sects of men and women and the meaningful is always becoming meaningless.112.

gurmukhi: ihq sMg kunwrn Aiq ibBcwrn ijn ky AYs pRkwr ]bf kul j`dpu aupjI bhu Cib q`dp piRA ibBcwr ]
transliteration: Hit San Kounaaran At(i) Bibhchaaran Jin Ke Ais Prakaar|| Bad Kul Jaddap(u) Oupji Bahu Chhab(i) Taddap Pria Bibhchaar||
translation: People will love wicked and vicious women and undoubtedly the women may have taken birth in superior clans, but they will be indulging in fornication;

gurmukhi: ic`qRq bhu ic`qRn kusm bic`qRn suMdr rUp Apwr ]ikDo dyv lok qj suFr suMdrI aupjI ibibD pukwr ]113]
transliteration: Chittrat Bahu Chittran Kousam Bachittran Soundar Roop Apaar|| Kidho Dev Lok Taj Sudhar Soundrioupjibibidh Prakaar||113||
translation: The women multi-coloured like flowers and like delicate creepers will look like the heavenly damsels coming down.113.

gurmukhi: ihq Aiq dur mwns kCU n jwns nr hr Aru bt pwr ]kCu SwsqR n mwnq ismiRq n jwnq bolq kuibD pRkwr ]
transliteration: Hit At(i) Dur Maanas Kachh(u) Na Jaanas Nar Bar Ar(u) Bat Paar|| Kachh(u) Shaastra Na Maanat Simrit Na Jaanat Dolat Koubidh Praknaar||
translation: The men will look to their interest secretly and all will act like robbers; they will not accept the Shastras and Smritis and will only talk in uncivilized way;

gurmukhi: kuSitq qy AMgn glq kurMgn Alp Ajoig AC`ij ]ikDo nrk Cor Avqry mhw psu folq piRQI inl`j ]114]
transliteration: Koushtit Te Anad Gadat Kuranad Alap Ajog(i) Achhajj(i)|| Kidho Narak Chhodh Avdare Mahaa Pas(u) Dolat Prithinilajj||114||
translation: Their limbs will decay because of leprosy and they will be subjected to fatal diseases; these people will roam on the earth unashamedly like animals as if they had come from hell and incarnated on earth.114.

gurmukhi: SMkr brn pujw BeI iek bRn rhw n koie ]skl sUdR pRwpq BeI deIv krY so hoie ]115]
transliteration: Shankar Baran Prajaa Bhai Ik Bran Rahaa Na Koe || Sakal Soodra Praapat Bhai Daeev Darai So Hoe||115||
translation: All the subjects became hybrid and none of the castes had remained in tact; all of them obtained the wisdom of Shudras and whatever the Lord desires, will happen.115.

gurmukhi: SMkr brn pRjw BeI Drm n kqhu rhwn ]pwp pRcur rwjw Bey BeI Drm kI hwn ]116]
transliteration: Shankar Baran Prajaa Bhai Dharam Na Kat-bu Rahaan|| Paap Prachur Raajaa Bhae Bhaidharam Kihaan||116||
translation: There had been no remnant of dharma and all the subjects became hybrid; the kings became the propagators of sinful acts the dharma declined.116.

gurmukhi: Drm n kqhUM rhwn pwp pRcur jg mo Drw ]Drm sBn ibsrwn pwp kMT sB jg kIE ]117]
transliteration: Dharam Na Kat-houn Rahaan Paap Prachur Jag Mo Dharaa|| Dharam Sabham Bisraan Paap Kanth Sabh Jag Keeo||117||
translation: The dharma was not visible in the world and the sin greatly prevailed in the world; everyone forgot dharma and the whole world was drowned upto the throat.117.

gurmukhi: kljug cVXo AsMB jgq kvn ibD bwc hY ]rMghu eykih rMg qb Cuitho kl kwl qy ]118]
transliteration: Kaljoug Chadyo Asanbh Jagad Kavan Baach Hai|| Ranoh Ekah(i) Ran Tah Chhueeiho Kal Kaal Te||118||
translation: The impossible Iron Age has come; in what way the world will be saved?â€™ till the time they are not imbued in the love of the one Lord, upto that time there will be no safety from the impact of the Iron Age.118.
